intro: Ecbolium barlerioides, commonly known as the desert sandmat, is a flowering plant native to arid regions of the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It is a low-growing perennial herb with small, fleshy leaves adapted to conserve water in harsh desert conditions. The plant produces clusters of small, white to pale pink flowers that bloom in late spring or early summer. Its root system is extensive and deep, allowing it to access moisture from deeper soil layers. Ecbolium barlerioides plays a role in stabilizing sandy soils and providing habitat for small desert organisms.
